title: Limbo
provenance_text:
William Ronald [1926-1998], Kingston, NJ [1]; Samuel M. Kootz Gallery, New York, NY [2]; acquired by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1958 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The Canadian artist moved from NYC to Kingston, NJ in 1957 (see curatorial file for biographical information.)
[2]. The painting was exhibited (no. 376, illustrated in the catalogue, plate 57) in "The 1958 Pittsburgh Bicentennial International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at Carnegie Institute, December 1958 - February 1959. It was lent by Samuel M. Kootz Gallery, with which the artist had a contract.
[3]. The painting was acquired by Carnegie Institute from the International as a gift from G. David Thompson, Pittsburgh, PA. It was accessioned on November 21, 1958. Payment to Kootz Gallery was sent on January 13, 1959.
